thread.title: J.K. Rowling Really Wants People To Stop Talking About Her Death
thread.title_full: J.K. Rowling Really Wants People To Stop Talking About Her Death

author: Ellie Bate
title: J.K. Rowling Really Wants People To Stop Talking About Her Death
text:
View this image ›
Joel Ryan / AP ID: 10488561 2. Her Twitter is honestly one of the best places on the internet, and if you don’t follow her already, you really, really should. Well, the fumes from the DVDs might be toxic and I've still got your money, so by all means borrow my lighter.
— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) ID: 10488581 3. Because yesterday, Jo shared this meme that had been making its way around the internet. The meme is…kind of morbid, to be honest. View this image ›
J.K. Rowling / Twitter: @jk_rowling ID: 10488585 4. Sure, the sentiment is all well and good, but can you imagine millions of people all making plans for when you die? Yeah, Jo wasn’t particularly into it either. This is very sweet, but I won't be offended if you untag me when making plans for my death.
— J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) ID: 10488604 5. Note: J.K. Rowling is generally not here for death chat. View this image ›
Twitter: @jk_rowling ID: 10488622 6. Well…not her own death, anyway. View this image ›
Warner Bros. ID: 10488639 7. SORRY. ID: 10488644 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
Ellie Bate is a celebrity reporter at BuzzFeed UK and is based in London.
